Param.Name: HTML

div.p: Nisha Acharya is the Director of the Uveitis and Ocular Inflammatory Disease Service and the Uveitis Fellowship at the F.I. Proctor Foundation. Her clinical expertise is the diagnosis and management of patients with infectious and inflammatory eye diseases.
Nancy Adler, PhD's research interests include Lobbying, health disparities, Clinic, Socioeconomically marginalized groups, and Children/youth.
Shelley Adler, PhD's research interests include Sociocultural gerontology, Palliative care, Medical education, End of life, and Interprofessional education.
Dr. Julia Adler-Milstein is an Associate Professor and Director of the Center for Clinical Informatics and Improvement Research (CLIIR).
My research focuses on the social and health system factors underlying disparities in reproductive, maternal, neonatal, and child health (RMNCH).
Anushree Agarwal, MD's research interests include pregnancy and heart disease, echocardiography, adult congenital heart disease, sudden death, and outcomes.

Dr. Akassoglou has pioneered studies in the investigation of vascular and immune mechanisms in neurologic diseases, and in particular the role of the blood clotting factors in CNS autoimmunity, trauma, and neurodegeneration.
Abbey Alkon, RN, PhD, FAAN's research has touched on Child Day Care Centers, Sympathetic Nervous System, Child Care, Autonomic Nervous System, Parasympathetic Nervous System
Isabel Elaine Allen, PhD's research interests include data display, Analytics & Data Visualization, Meta-analysis & synthesis research, Clinical Research Design & Analysis, and data visualization.

Theresa A. Allison, MD, PhD, is a Professor of Medicine in the Division of Geriatrics, with a secondary appointment in Family and Community Medicine. She completed both MD and PhD (in Musicology) through the University of Illinois Medical Scholars Program.
Our research focuses on the mechanobiologic pathways controlling stem cell and skeletal cell differentiation in bone and cartilage.

Dr Molly Anderson is a faculty member in the University of California San Francisco Department of General Internal Medicine and works in the Division of Hospital Medicine at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital.

Dr. Apollonio is Professor in the Department of Clinical Pharmacy at the University of California, San Francisco. She has served as an instructor and research mentor in the UCSF School of Pharmacy since 2004, and has earned multiple teaching awards.
Patricia Arean, PhD's research has touched on Behavior Therapy, Major Depressive Disorder, Psychotherapy, Mobile Applications, Depression

Michelle’s lab develops innovative approaches to screen for chemical tools and drug leads, using biophysical approaches like fragment-based drug discovery and biological approaches including high-content imaging with primary cells and organisms.
Dr. Rima Arnaout is an Assistant Professor in Medicine (Cardiology) and a member of the UCSF Institute for Computational Health Sciences (ICHS).
My research interests lie at the intersections of culture and health behavior, particularly as this relates to gender, sexuality, and HIV-related risk behavior.

Louise Aronson MD, MFA is Professor of Geriatrics at UCSF where her interests include optimizing healthcare for older adults, medical education, reflective learning, integrative geriatrics, and public medical writing.
FOCUS: Dr. Kirstin Aschbacher is an Associate Professor and Data Scientist in the Division of Cardiology at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).
Nancy Ascher, MD, PhD's research has touched on Graft Rejection, Liver Transplantation, Tissue and Organ Procurement, Organ Transplantation, Living Donors
Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) afflicts millions globally, causing significant joint deformity, pain, and functional disability.

h3.small: Assistant Professor, Family Health Care Nursing

div.p: As a researcher, registered nurse, and lactation consultant, I am extremely passionate about improving breastfeeding rates in Black communities. My research is centered on the intersection of race, gender, family dynamics, life course, and breastfeeding.
Dr. Aweeka has >25 years of experience as a clinical pharmacologist focusing on HIV, malaria and tuberculosis treatments.

The overall goal of my research is to develop novel therapies for the treatment of musculoskeletal diseases and injuries. Specifically, I believe we can drive improved tissue regeneration by recapitulating the normal sequences of development and repair.
Anuradha Banerjee, MD's research has touched on Glioma, Brain Stem Neoplasms, Central Nervous System Neoplasms, Brain Neoplasms, Benzimidazoles
The Barcellos-Hoff laboratory studies radiation carcinogenesis and biologically augmented radiotherapy.
Dr. Bardach is an Associate Professor of Pediatrics and Policy in the Department of Pediatrics and the Philip R. Lee Institute for Health Policy Studies at the University of California San Francisco.
Dementia prevalence is expected to triple worldwide over the next 40 years at tremendous monetary and emotional cost.
Amy Beck, MD, MPH's research interests include pediatric primary care, diabetes prevention, health disparities, Latino health, and obesity prevention.

h3.small: Assistant Professor, Family Health Care Nursing

div.p: In an effort to improve health equity and reduce health disparities, my area of research is, health promotion and obesity related chronic disease prevention (e.g.

h3.small: Assistant Professor, Anthro, History, Social Med

div.p: Alissa Bernstein, PhD, MPH, MA is a medical anthropologist and health policy researcher focused on understanding and improving the assessment, diagnosis, and care of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias, with a specific focus on primary care.
Lisa Bero, PhD's research has touched on Publication Bias, Tobacco Industry, Research Support as Topic, Conflict of Interest, Drug Industry
Kirsten Bibbins-Domingo, PhD, MD, MAS is the Lee Goldman, MD Endowed Chair in Medicine, Professor and Chair of the Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics, and Professor of Medicine.
Kara Birch, RN, DNP, NP's research interests include Patient Engagement, Culturally Appropriate Care, Interprofessional Education, Collaborative Care, Psychiatric Presentations of Medical Illnesses

Dr. Bishop is an Associate Professor of Psychology in Psychiatry at UCSF. She is a clinical psychologist with expertise in assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of individuals with autism spectrum disorders.
Charlene Blake, MD, PhD's research has touched on Vitronectin, Anesthesiology, Nucleotide Aptamers, Cardiac Procedures Anesthesia, Antidotes
Paula Braveman, MD, MPH is Professor of Family and Community Medicine and Director of the Center on Social Disparities in Health at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).
Penny Brennan, PhD's research has touched on Alcohol Drinking, Prescription Drug Misuse, Nursing Homes, Alcohol-Related Disorders, Alcoholism

h3.small: Professor, Institute for Health Policy Studies

div.p: Claire D. Brindis, Dr. P.H., is Professor of Pediatrics and Health Policy, Department of Pediatrics and the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Health Sciences at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF). She is Director of the Philip R.
V Courtney Broaddus, MD's research has touched on Apoptosis, Cellular Spheroids, Mesothelioma, Proto-Oncogene Proteins c-bcl-2, Pleura
Joelle Brown, PhD's research interests include safer conception, vaccines, reproductive health, HPV, and sub-Saharan Africa.

My research focuses on improving clinical outcomes among HIV-infected youth in sub-Saharan Africa and to study social network-informed approaches to support engagement in HIV care and improve HIV treatment outcomes.

h3.small: Associate Professor, Cell and Tissue Biology

div.p: Katja Brueckner received her PhD. in biology and cell signalling from the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and the University of Heidelberg, Germany. She performed her postdoctoral studies at the EMBL and Harvard Medical School.
Dr. Bush is an Associate Professor in the departments of Psychiatry and Pediatrics.
Dr. Byers is an epidemiologist with a background in aging research, methods, and biostatistics.
Carolyn S. Calfee, MD MAS is Professor in Residence of Medicine and Anesthesia at UCSF, where she attends in the intensive care units at Moffitt-Long Hospital.

I am a social demographer and behavioral scientist in the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology & Reproductive Sciences, with a joint appointment in the Department of Medicine, Center for AIDS Prevention Studies at UCSF.
Cynthia Campbell, PhD's research interests include health systems, Substance use research, health services and policy, and prescription opioids.
Kaitlin obtained her Ph.D. in Clinical Psychology from the UCSD/SDSU Joint Doctoral Program in 2016.
Marcelle Cedars, MD's research has touched on Female Infertility, Ovary, Ovarian Follicle, Fertilization in Vitro, Infertility

Soonmee Cha, MD, is a Professor In Residence of Radiology and Neurological Surgery at the University of California, San Francisco. She is the Diagnostic Radiology Residency Program Director, and she is Radiology's Vice-Chair of Education.
Dr. June M. Chan has broad interests in cancer prevention and public health, in particular what individuals can do to modify their risk of chronic disease, co-morbidity, and death.
Matilda Chan is a cornea specialist at the F.I. Proctor Foundation. Her clinical expertise is the diagnosis and management of patients with corneal and ocular surface diseases.

A transplant nephrologist with expertise in kidney and pancreas transplantation, Dr. Chandran earned her medical degree at All India Institute of Medical Sciences, and completed her residency at the University of Arizona.
Susan Chang, MD's research has touched on Glioblastoma, Brain Neoplasms, Glioma, Dacarbazine, Alkylating Antineoplastic Agents
Tissue engineering and regeneration are the next evolutionary step in surgical practice. Today, surgeons resect, reconstruct, and transplant to treat a diverse array of diseases.
Linda Chao, PhD, is a Professor in the Department of Radiology and Biomedical Imaging and in the Department of Psychiatry at the University of California, San Francisco.

Maria T. Chao, DrPH, MPA is an associate professor at the University of California San Francisco’s Osher Center for Integrative Medicine and the Division of General Internal Medicine at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital.
My research program is a direct reflection of my dual education in biology and Magnetic Resonance (MR) physics, and builds upon the synergy between these two fields.
Jennifer Chen, MD's research has touched on Chronic Hepatitis C, Infectious Pregnancy Complications, Stillbirth, Tricyclic Antidepressive Agents, Hepatic Stellate Cells
Dr. Iona Cheng is an epidemiologist with research interests focused on the role of genetics, health behaviors, environmental exposures, and neighborhood factors on cancer incidence and prognosis.
My research interests have been guided by a longstanding interest in genetics and developmental biology with a focus on reproductive biology.

Margaret A. Chesney is a Professor of Medicine at the UCSF Osher Center for Integrative Medicine. From 2010 to 2015, she served as the director of the UCSF Osher Center, with its three core programs in integrative medicine research, education and patient care.
Felicia Chow, MD's research has touched on HIV Infections, Breath Holding, Cerebrovascular Disorders, Stroke, Central Nervous System Infections

Dr. Christenson is an Assistant Professor at the University of California, San Francisco in the Division of Pulmonary, Critical Care, Allergy, and Sleep Medicine. She serves as an attending physician in the Critical Care Unit and Adult Pulmonary Clinic.
Carolyn Chu, MD's research interests include HIV and hepatitis education/training, HIV primary care, and HIV and hepatitis prevention.

Dr. Chung completed her MD (2001) at Johns Hopkins University where she was also an intern and resident (2001-04) in Internal Medicine. She was a Rheumatology Clinical Fellow at UCSF (2004-07), and joined the UCSF faculty in 2007.
Dr. Cocohoba is Professor of Clinical Pharmacy in the Department of Clinical Pharmacy at the University of California San Francisco. Dr. Cocohoba specializes in HIV/AIDS Ambulatory Care.
Deborah Cohan, MD, MPH's research interests include Embodied Medicine, Social Justice, HIV, Women's Health, and Mindfulness.
Dr. Cohen is an internist and clinical investigator whose research focuses on health outcomes in patients with posttraumatic stress disorder.
Geraldine Collins-Bride, RN, MS, FAAN's research has touched on Nursing Faculty Practice, Community Health Nursing, Nurse's Role, Nursing Schools, Nursing Models
Currently, my interests are the molecular epidemiology of antimalarial resistance in Uganda and the impact of drug and insecticide resistance on the transmission of malaria from humans to mosquitoes.
I am a behavioral scientist with multidisciplinary training from the fields of public health, psychology, anthropology, and sociology.
Alexandra D. Crosswell is an Assistant Professor at the Center for Health and Community within the Department of Psychiatry at UCSF. She obtained her PhD in Health Psychology from UCLA in 2014.
Maria Dall’Era, M.D. is professor of medicine in the Division of Rheumatology. Within rheumatology, her subspecialty is systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and lupus nephritis.

Dr. Sabrina Darrow is Assistant Professor and licensed psychologist in the Department of Psychiatry. She is passionate about improving the link between research and mental health services with the goal of empowering individuals to reach their personal goals.
Emily Dauria, PhD, MPH's research interests include HIV/AIDS, substance abuse, health disparities, sexually transmitted infections, and Social determinants of health.
Carol Dawson-Rose, RN, PhD, FAAN's research interests include Public Health, Substance Use and Abuse, Women's Health, Sexual and Gender Minority Health, and Vulnerable populations.

As a family physician with advanced training in family planning and a Masters Degree in Clinical Research, I perform research and clinical work designed to address the family planning needs of low-income, diverse populations.

My emerging research program is at a crossroads of chronic kidney disease, quality of life and outcomes related research. CKD is a major public health issue and its prevalence is expected to grow at an alarming rate in the United States.
Francesca Nesta Delling, MD, MPH's research interests include sudden cardiac death, cardiomyopathy, aortic valve disease, tricuspid valve disease, and mitral valve prolapse.
Carly Demopoulos, PhD's research has touched on Autism Spectrum Disorder, Autistic Disorder, Sensation Disorders, Speech, Social Perception

Dr. Desai’s research brings together advanced micro and nanotechnologies, fundamental insight into cellular behavior in engineered environments, and novel pharmacologic delivery approaches to address disease treatment and clinical translation.
Glenna Dowling, RN, PhD, FAAN's research has touched on Behavior Therapy, Video Games, Phototherapy, Caregivers, Hallucinations

The goal of our research is to investigate mechanisms of longevity, resilience and neurodegenerative disease. Broadly we investigate how aging pathways can confer resilience to a brain and counter neurodegenerative diseases like Alzheimer’s.
Ruth Dubin's research has touched on Chronic Kidney Failure, Left Ventricular Dysfunction, Left Ventricular Hypertrophy, Heart Failure, Chronic Renal Insufficiency
Sophie Dumont, PhD's research has touched on Spindle Apparatus, Microtubules, Chromosome Segregation, Kinetochores, Dyneins
Felice Dunn, PhD's research has touched on Retinal Bipolar Cells, Retinal Cone Photoreceptor Cells, Ocular Adaptation, Visual Pathways, Retina
Dr. Dzeng is a sociologist and hospitalist physician conducting research at the nexus of sociology, medical ethics, palliative and end-of-life care, and human-centered design.
Maria Ekstrand, PhD's research has touched on Social Stigma, Athletic Injuries, Dental Caries, India, Soccer
Alison El Ayadi, MPH, ScD's research has touched on Social Stigma, Gravity Suits, Postpartum Hemorrhage, Vaginal Fistula, Shock
Hana El-Samad, PhD's research has touched on Saccharomyces cerevisiae, Fungal Gene Expression Regulation, Saccharomyces cerevisiae Proteins, Physiological Feedback, Gene Regulatory Networks

Fanny Elahi is a board-certified neurologist with specific expertise in the evaluation and management of patients with cognitive and behavioral disorders due to degenerative brain diseases such as Alzheimer's disease and related disorders.
My lab is interested in the complex interplay between bacterial pathogens and host cells. In particular, we study two important human pathogens, Chlamydia trachomatis and Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

Elissa Epel, Ph.D, is a Professor in the Department of Psychiatry, at University of California, San Francisco. Her research aims to elucidate mechanisms of healthy aging, and to apply this basic science to scalable interventions that can reach vulnerable populations.

Dr. Laura Esserman, M.D., M.B.A is a surgeon and breast cancer oncology specialist practicing at the UCSF Carol Franc Buck Breast Care Center where she has also held the position of Director since 1996.

h3.small: Associate Professor, Institute for Health & Aging

div.p: Dr. Mica Estrada received her Ph.D. (1997) in Social Psychology from Harvard University and now is an Associate Professor in the Department of Social and Behavioral Sciences and the Institute for Health and Aging at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).
The overall goals of my research are to improve our understanding of chronic kidney disease and its consequences (e.g.
Elizabeth Fair, PhD, MPH's research has touched on Infectious Disease Medicine, Contact Tracing, Tuberculosis, Social Stigma, Gender Identity

Margaret Fang is a clinician-investigator and the Research Director of the UCSF Division of Hospital Medicine. She also serves as the Medical Director of the UCSF Anticoagulation Clinic and the Director of the UCSF Academic Hospital Medicine Fellowship.

Dr. Feeney is a Professor of Pediatrics and Chief of the Division of Pediatric Infectious Diseases and Global Health at UCSF. She is the Principal Investigator of several NIH-funded projects focused on the immune response to malaria and HIV among infants and children.
Dr. Fejerman’s research focuses on the discovery of genetic and non-genetic factors that contribute to breast cancer risk and prognosis in Latinas.
Jennifer Felder, PhD, is a licensed clinical psychologist dedicated to promoting women’s health during pregnancy and early parenting (i.e., the perinatal period).
Sandy Feng, MD, PhD's research has touched on Waiting Lists, Graft Survival, Liver Transplantation, End Stage Liver Disease, Tissue Donors
Alicia Fernandez, M.D., is a Professor of Medicine at UCSF and a general internist at Zuckerberg San Francisco General where she practices primary care medicine and attends on the medical wards.
Donna Ferriero, MD MS is a Distinguished Professor of Pediatrics and Neurology at UCSF. She is also a member of the Biomedical Sciences Graduate Program and the Weill Institute for Neurosciences.
Emily Finlayson's research interests include Functional Outcomes after Surgery, Research with Administrative Data, and Geriatric Surgery.
Our group works in three areas. In the first, we are studying the mechanisms used by the trophoblast cells of the human placenta to invade the uterus during normal pregnancy.
Valerie Flaherman, MD's research has touched on Weight Loss, Breast Milk Expression, Human Milk, Breast Feeding, Infant Formula
Dr. Kirsten Fleischmann is a cardiologist specializing in echocardiography and non-invasive cardiology.
Annesa Flentje, PhD's research interests include sexual and gender minority health, substance abuse treatment, intersectionality, sexual minority stress, and cognitive behavioral therapy.

My program of research focuses on precision medicine and risk for type 2 diabetes in high risk racial groups. Specifically, I am studying the utility of epigenetic biomarkers for risk detection and prediction of response to risk-reduction interventions.
Diana Greene Foster is a Demographer and Professor at the University of California, San Francisco, and Director of Research at UCSF's Advancing New Standards in Reproductive Health (ANSIRH).

CLINICAL INTERESTS: Elyse Foster is a cardiologist with special interests in Non-Invasive Cardiology, in particular, Echocardiography, Congenital Heart Disease in the Adult Population and Valvular Heart Disease.

My program of research focuses on health care for acutely and chronically ill infants and children, in primary, secondary and tertiary care settings, with a particular emphasis on pain assessment and management.

Lynda Frassetto, MD, is a Professor Emeritus of Medicine in the Division of Nephrology at the University of California, San Francisco (USCF). She grew up in the greater New York metropolitan area and attended college and medical school in Connecticut.
Susanna Fryer, PhD's research has touched on Prenatal Exposure Delayed Effects, Schizophrenia, Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders, Brain Waves, Psychotic Disorders

Dr. Fu’s research uses human genetics combined with multiple model organisms to investigate molecular mechanisms of human conditions. Her laboratory has been focusing on two areas: one in myelin biology and the other in circadian rhythm and sleep behaviors.

Dr. Fuentes-Afflick has been a UCSF faculty member since 1993. She is Professor and Vice Chair of Pediatrics, Chief of Pediatrics at the Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital, and Vice Dean for Academic Affairs in the School of Medicine.

Dr. Heather Fullerton is a pediatric vascular neurologist with an active clinical research program in childhood stroke. She is Chief of the UCSF Division of Child Neurology and Medical Director of the Pediatric Brain Center at Benioff Children’s Hospital.
Meghana Gadgil, MD's research interests include diet and nutrition, preventing chronic disease after pregnancy complications, prediabetes and type 2 diabetes
Our group investigates mechanisms, regulation, and biological functions of methyl group addition to proteins and RNA.

Monica Gandhi MD, MPH is Professor of Medicine and Associate Division Chief (Clinical Operations/ Education) of the Division of HIV, Infectious Diseases, and Global Medicine at UCSF/ San Francisco General Hospital.

Dr. Garber is an Associate Professor of Pediatrics in the Division of Adolescent Medicine at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF), with a joint appointment in the School of Public Health at the University of California, Berkeley (UCB).
As a clinician investigator, Dr. Garcia focuses on co-morbid mental health and chronic diseases and their disproportionate impact on vulnerable and marginalized populations.
Jennifer Garrison, PhD's research has touched on Endoplasmic Reticulum, Smell, Animal Sexual Behavior, Vasopressins, Oxytocin
Elena Gates, MD's research has touched on Bioethical Issues, Personal Autonomy, Trial of Labor, Medical Ethics, Prenatal Diagnosis
Ruby Ghadially, MD's research has touched on Aldehyde Dehydrogenase, Skin Aging, Keratinocytes, Epidermis, Stem Cells

The Giacomini research group focuses on expanding our understanding of membrane transporters. Membrane transporters are of great pharmacological importance, as they play a major role in drug efficacy by regulating drug disposition and distribution.
Milena Gianfrancesco, PhD, MPH's research has touched on Multiple Sclerosis, Genetic Predisposition to Disease, Machine Learning, Body Mass Index, Hydroxychloroquine
Dr. Gibson is a psychologist and health services researcher based at the San Francisco VA. Her research focuses on women’s physical and mental health related to menopause and aging.

Linda C. Giudice, MD, PhD is Distinguished Professor, Chair Emerita, and the Robert B. Jaffe MD Endowed Professor in the Reproductive Sciences in the Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Sciences at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).
Dr. Hannah Glass is a pediatric neurologist, founding co-director of the Neurointensive Care Nursery (NICN), and Director of Neonatal Critical Care Services at the UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital.
Orit Glenn, MD, is a Professor in the Neuroradiology Section in the Department of Radiology, with additional expertise in pediatric and fetal neuroimaging.
Maria Glymour, ScD, MS's research has touched on Stroke, Spouses, Memory Disorders, Health Status Disparities, Educational Status
Scarlett Gomez's research has touched on Breast Neoplasms, Social Class, Residence Characteristics, Ethnic Groups, Asian Americans

I am a physician-scientist with an interest in airway epithelial dysfunction in asthma. Specifically, my lab focuses on understanding how genetic risk variants that are associated with asthma at a population level, actually confer risk of disease at a molecular level.

Dr. Maria Luisa Gorno Tempini is a behavioral neurologist, currently directing the Language Neurobiology laboratory of the UCSF Memory and Aging Center and serving as the neurology lead of the UCSF Dyslexia Center.

Deborah Grady, MD, MPH is Professor of Epidemiology and Biostatistics and of Medicine, Vice Chair of the Department of Epidemiology and Director of the UCSF/Mount Zion Women's Health Clinical Research Center and the UCSF Women's Health Faculty Development Program.
Dr. Jennifer R. Grandis received her medical degree from the University of Pittsburgh School of Medicine, Pennsylvania, and completed her internship from the same institution.
I am Medical Director for Cardiology Clinical Services at San Francisco General Hospital.

I am an Infectious Diseases trained Internist based in the Department of Clinical Pharmacy, in the UCSF School of Pharmacy. My research is focused on HIV infection in women, particularly the effects of gonadal aging and pharmacology.
Valerie Gribben, MD's research interests include narrative medicine, trainee career development, vaping, women in medicine, and design thinking.
Carol Gross, PhD's research has touched on DNA-Directed RNA Polymerases, Heat-Shock Proteins, Escherichia coli Proteins, Escherichia coli, Sigma Factor
Vanessa Grubbs, MD's research interests include palliative care, end-stage kidney disease, kidney transplant disparities, and creative writing.

I am a clinical psychologist with research and clinical interests focused on 1) cultural influences to mental health conceptualization, assessment, and treatment, and 2) accessible and culturally appropriate evidence-based services for vulnerable youth and families worldwide. …
Mary Haan, DrPH, MPH's research has touched on Aging, Hispanic Americans, Dementia, Mexican Americans, Acculturation
I am a Professor in Residence in the HIV, ID, and Global Medicine Division in the Department of Medicine.
Dr. Monica Hahn is an Assistant Clinical Professor at UCSF in the Department of Family & Community Medicine.
Joanna Halkias, MD's research has touched on Cell Movement, Thymus Gland, Thymocytes, CCR7 Receptors, Lymphopoiesis
Sharon Hall, PhD's research has touched on Substance Withdrawal Syndrome, Methadone, Smoking, Smoking Cessation, Tobacco Use Disorder
Dr. Rita Hamad is a social epidemiologist and family physician in the Philip R. Lee Institute for Health Policy Studies and the Department of Family & Community Medicine at UCSF.

Dr. Margaret Handley is a public heath-trained epidemiologist in the Departments of Epidemiology and Biostatistics and the Center for Vulnerable Populations, at the University of California San Francisco, Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital.

Cynthia C. Harper, PhD, is a Professor in Residence in the UCSF Department of Obstetrics, Gynecology and Reproductive Sciences, and is the Director of the UCSF-Kaiser BIRCWH (Building Interdisciplinary Research Careers in Women's Health) K12 scholar training program.
Charlene Harrington, RN, PhD, FAAN's research has touched on Personnel Staffing and Scheduling, Home Care Services, Medicaid, Nursing Homes, Nursing Staff

h3.small: Associate Professor, Institute for Health & Aging

div.p: Julie Harris-Wai, PhD, MPH's research has touched on Family, Genetic Testing, Family Relations, Melanoma, Communication

Krista Harrison, PhD, is a health services, policy and ethics researcher focused on improving systems of care for older adults with dementia and other serious illnesses who live in home- and community-based settings.
The goal of my research is to develop therapeutic strategies to improve the lives of persons living with HIV, to reduce the global burden of HIV, and to advance public health in East Africa.

Mechanical loads manifest into strains within tissues and interfaces of an organ. Strains within tissues are transduced by the cells to produce the needed extracellular matrix proteins to meet functional demands.
Fumiko Hoeft MD PhD is Professor of Child & Adolescent Psychiatry and Weill Institute for Neurosciences and directs the UCSF Hoeft Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience Laboratory (brainLENS.org).
Jill Hollenbach, PhD, MPH's research has touched on KIR Receptors, Histocompatibility Testing, HLA-DRB1 Chains, Immunogenetics, HLA Antigens

h3.small: Associate Professor, Institute for Health & Aging

div.p: Brooke Hollister, PhD, is an Assistant Professor of Sociology in the Institute for Health & Aging at the University of California, San Francisco.

Dr. Michelle Hsiang’s career is focused on improving the health of children through clinical care and the study of malaria, an infectious disease that is one of the leading causes of morbidity and mortality in resource-limited settings.
I am a basic science and pre-clinical researcher interested in molecular and cellular immunology and inflammation.

Professional Experience: Dr. Hsue trained in Internal Medicine in the Molecular Medicine Training Program at UC San Francisco and in Cardiovascular Medicine at UC San Francisco. She served as Chief Cardiology Fellow during this time.
Dr. Alison Huang is an internal medicine physician, clinical epidemiologist, clinical trialist, and women's health investigator at the University of California San Francisco.
Dr. Chiung-Yu Huang is Professor of Biostatistics at the Department of Epidemiology and Biostatistics and an elected Fellow of the American Statistical Association (ASA).

I am PhD-trained nurse practitioner and health services researcher with a research focus on understanding the geriatric palliative care needs and experiences of older adults with dementia across care settings.
Susan Hyde, DDS, MPH, PhD's research interests include program evaluation, Oral health, interprofessional education, welfare reform, dental public health
Nola Hylton, PhD, is a Professor in Residence in the Department of Radiology and Biomedical Imaging, and Director of the Breast Imaging Research Group at the University of California, San Francisco.
Those who devote their lives to creative pursuits are often inspired by a singular event.
Sabra Inslicht, PhD's research interests include PTSD, Fear conditioning, Prolonged Exposure Therapy for PTSD, Women's Heart Disease, and Infertility.
Roshanak Irannejad, PhD's research has touched on Endocytosis, Endosomes, G-Protein-Coupled Receptors, Dobutamine, beta-1 Adrenergic Receptors
Dr. Sam Irwin is a board-certified child neurologist and headache specialist at UCSF.
I am a practicing general internist and investigator in the Division of General Internal Medicine at the University of California San Francisco.
Kirsten Johansen, MD's research has touched on Kidney Diseases, Chronic Renal Insufficiency, Chronic Kidney Failure, Renal Dialysis, Body Composition

Julene K Johnson, PhD is both the Associate Dean of Research for the UCSF School of Nursing and the Associate Director at the UCSF Institute for Health & Aging. She is also the Research Education Core Lead and mentor in the UCSF Center for Aging in Diverse Communities.…
Meshell Johnson, MD's research interests include critical care, resuscitation, simulation, lung injury, and alveolar type I cells.
Dr. Galen Joseph, Ph.D. is a Professor of Anthropology in the Department of Anthropology, History and Social Medicine at the University of California, San Francisco.
Vasantha Jotwani, MD's research has touched on Kidney Tubules, Tenofovir, Kidney Diseases, Chronic Renal Insufficiency, Alpha-Globulins
Natalia Jura, PhD's research has touched on Neuregulin-1, Phosphotransferases, Proto-Oncogene Proteins c-met, ErbB-3 Receptor, ErbB Receptors

Dr. Kaiser's goal is to improve quality of care for hospitalized children by accelerating use of evidence-based guidelines in clinical practice. She is currently supported by a Career Development Award from the Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality.

Tonya Kaltenbach, MD's research interests include Endoscopic Mucosal Resection (EMR), Image Enhanced Endoscopy, Detection of Nonpolypoid (Flat) Lesions, Balloon Assisted Deep Enteroscopy (single and double balloon), and Complex Polypectomy.
I have focused my clinical research in the field of type 2 diabetes and obesity and have developed a three-pronged research program that is unified under this theme.

Mi-Suk Kang Dufour is an Assistant Professor in the UCSF Division of Prevention Science, and the Global Health Sciences group. She also teaches in the Biostatistics and Epidemiology division at UC Berkeley.
Aimee Kao, MD, PhD's research has touched on Intercellular Signaling Peptides and Proteins, Tuberous Sclerosis, Physiological Stress, TDP-43 Proteinopathies, Osmotic Pressure

Dr. Karliner is Professor in Residence in the Division of General Internal Medicine, Department of Medicine at the University of California, San Francisco (UCSF).

Galateia J. Kazakia, PhD, is an Associate Professor in Residence and Director of Bone Quality Research Laboratory in the Department of Radiology and Biomedical Imaging at the University of California, San Francisco.
Susan M. Kegeles, PhD is Professor of Medicine at the UCSF School of Medicine, in the Division of Prevention Science, and Co-Director of the Center for Prevention Studies (CAPS).

My research program is in developmental lung disease. I am interested in the evaluation of prognostic factors, biomarkers and consequences of lung disease related to extreme prematurity or birth defects (specifically, congenital diaphragmatic hernia).
Karla Kerlikowske, MD's research has touched on Breast, Early Detection of Cancer, Breast Density, Breast Neoplasms, Mammography
My research focuses on identifying risk factors that predispose younger individuals to stroke and cardiovascular disease.
I am Professor of the Division of Biostatistics at UCSF and Director of the Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center Biostatistics Shared Resource Core.

Young Shin Kim, MD, MS, MPH, PhD, is a child and adolescent psychiatrist who focuses on the distribution of childhood onset neuropsychiatric disorders and disruptive behavioral problems, including autism and bullying.

Ava Wu, DDS's research has touched on Salivary Glands, Dental Caries, Artificial Saliva, Sjogren's Syndrome, Xerostomia
Dr. Lani Wu is interested in discovering principles underlying cellular individuality, the emergence of collective cellular behaviors, and the evolution of drug resistance.
Dr. Yvonne Wu is a child neurologist and epidemiologist with expertise in newborn brain injury and cerebral palsy (CP).
Melisa Wong, MD, MAS is a thoracic oncologist who treats patients with lung cancer and other thoracic malignancies. Dr. Wong has a particular interest in caring for older adults with cancer.

Kathy Yang, Pharm.D., MPH is a Health Sciences Clinical Professor in the Department of Clinical Pharmacy at the University of California (UCSF) School of Pharmacy and an Infectious Diseases Clinical Pharmacist in the UCSF Medical Center.

h3.small: Assistant Professor, Institute for Health & Aging

div.p: Dr. Yao's research focuses on the economic impact of tobacco products and marijuana. Her current studies include estimating the impact of price on the demand for cigarettes and e-cigarettes and for cigarettes and marijuana.

Dr. Yazdany is Chief of the Division of Rheumatology at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital (ZSFG) and the Alice Betts Endowed Professor of Medicine at UCSF. She received her undergraduate degree from Stanford, her MD from UCLA, and her MPH from Harvard.

h3.small: Assistant Professor, Institute for Health & Aging

div.p: Jarmin Yeh, MPH's research has touched on City Planning, Independent Living, Cities, Social Planning, Disabled Persons
Midori Yenari, MD's research has touched on Brain Ischemia, Induced Hypothermia, Stroke, HSP70 Heat-Shock Proteins, Neuroprotective Agents

Jennifer Yokoyama obtained her doctorate degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences and Pharmacogenomics from UCSF in December 2010 with Dr. Steven Hamilton (Department of Psychiatry and Institute for Human Genetics).
Christina Yoon, MD, MPH's research has touched on Tuberculosis, Point-of-Care Testing, Pulmonary Tuberculosis, HIV Infections, C-Reactive Protein
Lydia Zablotska, MD, PhD's research has touched on Radiation-Induced Neoplasms, Chernobyl Nuclear Accident, Thyroid Neoplasms, Occupational Exposure, Iodine Radioisotopes
Dr. Zhu’s research has been focusing on the interface of disease etiology and prevention strategies in women’s and children’s cardiometabolic health.
Our laboratory is interested in understanding how autoreactive B cells, despite chronic antigen engagement of the B cell receptor, are restrained from inappropriate activation and differentiation.

Param.p: This page was generated based on information in UCSF Profiles. It has people who have titles of Assistant, Associate or full Professor, who have obtained NIH grant support, who have photos in their pages and use "she/her pronouns" in their profile overviews, or have a loosely similar name in the SSA's list of the most common girls' names of the 1980s. Because of these limitations, this page is not a fully representative sample of all female-identified researchers at UCSF Last updated: June 21, 2019
